skills.title: MERN
skills.description: MERN is a full-stack, following the traditional 3-tier architectural pattern, including the front-end display tier (React.js), application tier (Express.js and Node.js), and database tier (MongoDB).

skills.title: MongoDB
skills.description: MongoDB is document object database designed for ease of development and scaling.If your application stores any data (user profiles, content, comments, uploads, events, etc.)then you’re going to want a database that’s just as easy to work with as Express, React, and Node.

skills.title: Express
skills.description: Express is backend web application framework for Node.js and server-side framework, running inside a Node.js server. Express.js bills itself as a “fast, unopinionated, minimalist web framework for Node.js,” and that is indeed exactly what it is.

skills.title: React
skills.description: React is javaScript library for building user interfaces and is top tier of the MERN stack is React.js, the declarative JavaScript library for creating dynamic client-side applications in HTML. React lets you build up complex interfaces through simple Components, connect them to data on your backend server, and render them as HTML.

skills.title: Node.js
skills.description: Node is designed to build scalable network applications and an open-source, cross-platform, back-end JavaScript runtime environment that runs on the V8 engine and executes JavaScript code outside a web browser.

skills.title: JavaScript
skills.description: JavaScript is the world's most popular programming language and is lightweight, interpreted, or just-in-time compiled programming language with first-class functions.

skills.title: JSON
skills.description: JSON stands for 'JavaScript Object Notation' is an open standard file format and data interchange format that uses human-readable text to store and transmit data objects consisting of attribute–value pairs and arrays (or other serializable values).

skills.title: Markdown
skills.description: Markdown is a lightweight markup language for creating formatted text using a plain-text editor.

skills.title: HTML5
skills.description: HTML5 stands for 'Hyper Text Markup Language' for creating Web pages

skills.title: CSS3
skills.description: CSS3 stands for 'Cascading Style Sheets' and describes how HTML elements are to be displayed on screen.

skills.title: SASS
skills.description: SASS stands for 'Syntactically Awesome Style Sheets' that’s compiled to CSS. It allows you to use variables, nested rules, mixins, functions, and more, all with a fully CSS-compatible syntax. Sass helps keep large stylesheets well-organized and makes it easy to share design within and across projects.

skills.title: CSS-Flexbox
skills.description: Flexible Box Layout Module makes it easier to design flexible responsive layout structure.

skills.title: CSS-Grid
skills.description: CSS-Grid is layout Module and offers a grid-based layout system with rows and columns, making it easier to design web pages.

skills.title: Bootstrap
skills.description: Bootstrap is quickly design and customize responsive mobile-first sites with Bootstrap, the world’s most popular front-end open source toolkit, featuring Sass variables and mixins, responsive grid system, extensive prebuilt components, and powerful JavaScript plugins.

skills.title: GitHub
skills.description: GitHub is a Git repository hosting service and it adds many of its own features. While Git is a command line tool, GitHub provides a Web-based graphical interface. It also provides access control and several collaboration features, such as a wikis and basic task management tools for every project.

skills.title: VSCode
skills.description: VSC stands for 'Visual Studio Code' is a lightweight but powerful source code editor which runs on your desktop and is available for Windows, macOS and Linux. It comes with built-in support for JavaScript, TypeScript and Node.js and has a rich ecosystem of extensions for other languages (such as C++, C#, Java, Python, PHP, Go) and runtimes (such as .NET and Unity).

skills.title: Git
skills.description: Git is a free and open source distributed version control system designed to handle everything from small to very large projects with speed and efficiency.

skills.title: RegExp
skills.description: Regular expression tester with syntax highlighting, explanation, cheat sheet for PHP/PCRE, Python, GO, JavaScript, Java. Features a regex quiz & library.

skills.title: Languages
skills.description: I speak the following four languages
